He apologized for it and let us know it was being remade.  After the remade salad came out, everything was fine with the food. We were there for about two hours and our server came around to check on us and refill waters only twice. After we left we were ticked that we had to pay for the salad that they left their dirty food sticker in, so we only left an 8% tip instead of the "suggested 15%". But to be fare, they messed up our food and the service was below average. Before I had even left the table the server came around and looked at the bills to find her tip-- while i was still putting my jacket on. My friends had already exited the restaurant, as i was leaving my server chased me down to let me know that her tips are taxed and we are supposed to tip at least 15%. I explained to her that i wasn't satisfied with the service and that tips are not mandated. She finally let me alone all pissed off. I finally left 15 minutes later after having a conversation with the manager there, Sal, who was also less than helpful regarding the situation.

Normally I like to support small businesses but it was my husband's birthday and he was craving cheesecake so he choose this spot and I couldn't argue. We parked in the structure nearest the movie theater and walked in.  I suppose you could valet for closer access to your car but we like a little spectrum stroll so the structure won. We walked in and there was about 10 people around waiting for tables but we only waited 10 mins or so - which I was thankful for since I got extra time to look at the menu. The novel-length menu gives me a mild anxiety attack every time.  Normally I'm a bit indecisive in ordering which is why I use my trusty yelp app to guide my restaurant endeavors but this trip my phone was dead so I asked our server what she recommended and she came back with "Well what do you feel like?" and all I could say was "chicken" so she directed me to the chicken page but I ended up throwing my hands up and letting my husband choose both dishes anyway.... go figure. If there's one thing I know about this place (besides the menu being 100+ entrees long) its that the portion is at least 3x the size it should be.  Thankfully, this trip around the menu stumped my husband as well so he and I agreed to share the two dishes he was between - it was his birthday after all. I ordered Cajun Jambalaya Pasta (Shrimp and Chicken Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a Very Spicy Cajun Sauce. All on Top of Fresh Linguini.) and he got the Chicken Bellagio (Crispy Coated Chicken Breast over Basil Pasta and Parmesan Cream Sauce Topped with Prosciutto and Arugula Salad). He doesn't normally eat greens so I got his arugula salad which was nicely dressed with a lemon dressing.  My Cajun Jambalaya was really delicious. I was actually very surprised that a chain could produce such tender linguini and the spice was just right... I wouldn't consider it "very spicy" like the menu states.  It was flavorful without blowing my head off or anything. My husband gave me a bite of his chicken bellagio and the prosciutto/chicken/basil pasta combo was very delicious as well.  I was happily surprised!  We both ate about half and took the rest home... the price reflects the portion - at least you know you're going to have a yummy lunch the next day as well! We ordered a piece of banana cheesecake to share and it was smooth and creamy with just the right amount of sweetness.  Sometimes cheesecake is too decadent to have more than 2 bites of... not this one. We definitely finished it. All in all, I was glad hubby chose this for his birthday meal.   I have a new respect for cheesecake factory and probably won't avoid it like the plague anymore... at least I know that I'll always have something new to try and I'll never exhaust the menu! :)
Great service. Sunday afternoon. Favorite part of the meal was the Factory Salad. Thank you Michael!

I was disappointed on 8-5-2016 My 4 year old grandsons wanted a Chessecake for his birthday. So I went to Irvine Spectrum at 1 pm and all thier cakes are frozen "Fully aware " drove home to Orange and took it out  when it was time to sing  3 hrs later and it was falling apart literally the gram was stuck to the cupboard and it was not Fresh at all never again will I throw money that way very disappointed and checkout was at a crawl I was the only one ordering

This place has really lost its quality.  We ordered take out and when we got home our Cobb salad has brown wilted lettuce.  Disgusting!  The other food was just okay.  I seriously wondered if the lights were dim in the kitchen to have served this food to us or if they just didn't care.  Guess we will be eating at CPK instead of CF from now on at the Irvine Spectrum.  Cheesecake seems to be the only thing good here anymore.

I go to cheesecake factory almost every weekend. Even though it gets busy during the weekends, the staff are always doing their best to serve people as fast as they can. The food is always great, and my fave dish would have to be the cajun jambalaya pasta ; perfection.  Also, I always try a different smoothie and all of them are refreshing, especially the peach smoothie. Yumm * gets dressed and heads to the place*

My boyfriend and I came here the day before Valentine's Day and had Stephanie as our server. We've had her before and she's not the friendliest. We were checked on only a couple of times and not offered what is always available. Food was good, service was OK.

We usually avoid eating at this restaurant at the Spectrum because it is usually always crazy busy and too long of a wait to eat here.  I had a gift card to redeem and we decided to grab some dinner here on a weekday.  Since summer season was over and we arrived early for dinner, we were seated right away and it was great! I do enjoy that their menu is basically a little book and there are many, many options for eats here.  Always helpful when you have a large group of people with varied eating preferences.  But it is hard to make a decision sometimes when you have so many choices.  I do enjoy their Factory Burger Kobe burger and decided to try the Mushroom Burger since it recently won their Glamburger challenge according to the menu.  I enjoyed the sauteed mushrooms and melted Fontina and Swiss cheeses on the burger.    A nice burger but I still think the Factory burger and Kobe burger here are my favorites.  The fries that came with the burger were awesome, perfectly good and straight out of the fryer.  Everything on the plate arrived piping hot to the table, so that was great.   It is a very rare occasion I come to eat here and forgo cheesecake, since i LOVE cheesecake, and they have so many wonderful varieties here.  We decided to split their featured cheesecake which was the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake.     Our waiter described it as not too sweet but extremely rich.  That was a perfect way to describe it.  It had a bottom layer of chocolate cake and had a layer of cheesecake with Oreos in it, Oreo cookie mousse and chocolate icing with an Oreo cookie wafer on top and a dollop of whipped cream on the side.  OMG, it was heavenly.  A perfect slice.  Definitely one I would order again.  An Oreo cookie lover's dream and not too sweet.  Our waiter, Johnny, was outstanding.  He was working hard, serving tables both inside the restaurant and outside on the patio, but he was such a great waiter, super friendly, very informative, attentive on our refills and checked back on us often.  A definite standout as far as servers I have had at any Cheesecake Factory.  Always nice to get out on a weekday, have a good meal, outstanding service and end the evening with a yummy piece of cheesecake :)

I ate here a few Sunday's ago and the food was so bad I couldn't eAt it. The place was so busy I felt sorry for our waiter so I didn't ask for my money back on the calamari . I thought I would write the Manager a little note with my receipt and it's been two weeks and I've not heard from them . I wanted them to write back with a apology before I went to Yelp . Oh well I guess their to busy

I love the Cheesecake Factory. It's a good date night hang out stop for this location. It's pretty convenient since you can do other stuff too, like go shopping or watch a movie or something.  And I love their cheesecakes too. It's rich and fatty.  But you should do yourself a favor and never ever look at the calorie count of the stuff you eat here. You will be very surprised on how high these things can go up to. Take for example the Pasta Carbonara with chicken I ordered. Great stuff, super buttery, fatty richy goodness. My friend told me to look up the nutritutional value for shits and giggles on our way out of the restaurant, and it was over 2600 calories. I almost literally fell into shock...literally. For the next several hours, I felt like the whole world was spinning, that I was hallucinating and all that...and this coming from a bowl of some fatty pasta. Well, it was a good lessons learned. Don't look at the calorie count. It will seriously f you up. But the cheesecake helps though

Came here to celebrate mom's bday. Came late to meet little sister and mom after work. Went up to hostesses to ask where they were seated I get a "you can just look around." WTF is that? This place gets flow because it's at Irvine spectrum so I wasn't expecting much, but seriously?? I mean ain't your job to greet and say hello? I was so surprised I didn't even get upset at first just shocked followed by pure disappointment. HIRE BETTER HOSTESSES PLEASE. On a side note. Our server was awesome and food was what was to be expected.  3.5 stars for Food 5 stars for our server 1 star for the WORST greeting I've ever received when entering a restaurant. Date was 7/27/15 for management to reference.

Only second time here, first was over 3 years ago. We ordered only fish and pizza since they don't serve halal meat. Loved the salmon and fish and chips. Wished they didn't cook their Herb Salmon with wine, it may have been a tasty choice.

Worst service ever. Waited 20 minutes for two slices of cheesecake. The server had already taken out the slices and left it near the sink where several employees habitually washed their hands. The service was inefficient as they prioritized those seated, leaving a long line of customers who are ordering takeouts waiting a long time. In future, please inform your patrons of the wait time and seriously serve those in accordance with the order queue separating patrons who are eating in and those who are ordering takeouts.

This was my first visit to a Cheesecake Factory in a long time. We wound up here after dodging some rare July rain last weekend on an OC staycation and decided to come to the mall. We were seated in about ten minutes and the service was great. Food was great too.

This place was horrible. It took 45 minutes to get seated. It took 20 minutes to finally we got to order anything. The appetizer came out with our main course. The steak was over cooked and was way to salty, couldn't eat it. The only thing that was good was the drinks and desert. The service and food is horrible. I do not recommend this place to anyone and I'm easy to please.

I can't complain. I really like The Cheesecake Factory as far as restaurant chains go. Okay. Well, sometimes I am a little overwhelmed by their vast menu, but they have enough choices to the point I appreciate it - not to the point where I feel like I'm reading a novel. Hehe. Anyway, our server's name was Angela. She was friendly, nice, and knowledgeable. She brought out our drinks in a timely manner and kept them refilled. She even brought out water and food - bananas and bread - for my baby. (Thank you!) We ordered cream of mushroom soup, a hamburger, shepherd's pie, and lemon garlic shrimp. For dessert, we got the mango key lime cheesecake to share. All the food was delicious, thus making out visit to The Cheesecake Factory satisfactory!

Go for the Sunday brunch. The French toast and lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for delicious! No bottomless mimosas but just going for the food is worth it! For breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert or drinks, I always get excellent service and the food is great!
Had an amazing time with my wife here. Sean H. was our waiter and he absolutely did an amazing job. Absolutely flawless service, I don't know if you can request waiters but if so ask for Sean.

Never dined in this location, I just stopped by to pick up a few slices of cakes. Review is based on flavor of two particular cake slices only, nothing about service, ambience, other foods, and cleanness.  I got the tallest chocolate layer cake slice and a slice of Adam's crunch peanut butter cheese cake to go. These two slices will last for a week. They are big, rich in flavor, and dense in texture. I hate whipped cream but they didn't put it on top of cakes so I scraped them off as soon as I got home. I wish they ask before putting whipped cream chunks because not everyone likes the cream.  The crunch candy was like butter finger orange colored candy piece inside Adam's cheese cake was very sweet, also light peanut butter colored cream chunk on top of cake was also too sweet and nasty. But cheese cake itself was tasted very rich cheese cakey, and the cookie crust was perfectly thin and crispy.  Layer chocolate cake was very rich and dense. It was sweet, but it was also good enough to satisfy sugar craving with just a few bites.  I am set for sugar craving for a while and the two big cake slices will last for a while as well. They are pretty pricey.

Pros and Cons  Pros  1. Delicious food  2. Nice Decor  3. Lots of Seating 4. Good Location  Cons 1. Service can be slow at times I enjoy coming to the Cheesecake Factory a lot because their food is always delicious. The best dish they have in my opinion is their Cuban Sandwich which has ham, pork, pickles, and mustard.  Their Sunrise Fiesta Burrito is also very good as well.  The location is very accessible and easy to find.

Love this place and this location staff is great our waitress was wonderful the bartender was slow but poured a good drink the food was great and portions were good variety if cheesecakes are always amazing
Food is always delicious and service is great if for any reason something is wrong they fix it and comp your meal.

The most unorganized Cheesecake Factory and restaurant overall that I've ever been to.  Waited about 20 minutes (I was told it was a 10 minute wait) and our beeper buzzed. Came inside and was told to wait on the side for my server... It's been an additional 15 minutes :) Group after group were being called with no response but they still waited for these people to show up when there's customers here that are ready to go. There has to be a better system but doesn't matter, we won't be returning.

Not my first choice in dining, but would be happy to go if invited with friends. Menu selection is good and probably why the restaurant is crowded.  From sandwiches to steaks, or ice-cream to cheesecake, there's probably something on the menu for every guest of your dinner party. I gave it a 3 star because the food itself is just okay and the service is hit or miss.  Though most of the time I have had good service once the food arrives; it's the long wait times to sit at a table or to finally get your food that take away from the enjoyment of eating here.

The portions are big I haven't been to the Cheesecake Factory in over 15 years came with a friend I haven't seen in awhile, I have traveled all over the world , and had dinner at several fine restaurants. The food is awesome at the Cheesecake Factory. I can highly recommend  the Chipotle Chicken pasta and the Sheila's chicken and avocado salad . Our server armenica was the best she should be head server.  Don't forget to get the passion fruit mojitos to go with it and to finish off with the sea salted caramel cheesecake.

We were told the wait would be 25-30 minutes, which was not a problem.  Buzzer went off, so we went to the counter.  We were told to wait on the tile.  Twenty minutes later we were still waiting!  The slip with our party's name was misplaced.  After we  brought this to the manager's attention, we were seated.  Waited 15 minutes for our drinks after ordering them (mostly waters). Ordered food and had to wait 25 minutes for that to be served.

Attitude.   We walk in all smiles and on our runners high as we just finished a 5k down the road.  We walk up to the hostess kind of a short gal with dark hair she doesn't even look up from the computer screen she's just says how many??  Um.. Ok.. Party of four.   Again without even looking up from the computer screen she says - 15mins.   Wow! We sat down at the little bench seating near the hostess station. I decided to wash my hands before lunch and walk back up to her.  I asked where the restrooms were located and for the third time she refused to make eye contact, smile or even pretend that she's happy to be there-  she just says they're behind her or something.   I'm over this place and ready to walk but just then another gal says our table is ready.  We're hungry and decide to stay.   A different gal who brought us to our table said the rude gals name was Sylvia but who knows.  What I do know is this hostess is HORRIBLE. Our server was awesome and of course the food was good but our experience with the hostess ruined our $120.00 lunch.   Thanks Sylvia!
I had great experience at the Spectrum's branch!  Kayla, our waitress was amazing!! She did great job in her recommendations and was very polite.

Cheesecake Factory. It's always been a place where I went with friends for hours of catch up over way too much food. It's always been a place where we stopped to eat after shopping and ogle at the rows of cheesecake and deciding before we even order our entrees what kind of cheesecake we are going to get. Maybe it's because I just have so many fond memories here, I find it really hard to dislike this restaurant despite the crazy long lines and food I get tired of eating half way through.  I've tried bits of everything here over the years and there is no doubt that the food tastes good. Yes its a bit pricey, but its huge so you can't really complain. My favorite here is the Chicken Carbonara and I usually stick to that now. I always want to get the cheesecake here but usually end up not getting any because I am simply too full. But the classic strawberry cheesecake is quite delightful.  Come here with your friends, grab a few drinks and laugh the night away. Or bring a lover. It's just as good. 4/5

I've never liked The Cheesecake Factory until I discovered their veggie burger. It sounds very lack-luster, but it is one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. It's a hearty, yet flavorful patty that's served with a delicious garlicky-mayo.  And of course, the dessert! My favorite cheesecake here is the Banana Cream Cheesecake. It sounds gross, and a little boring, but it's absolutely delectable. Don't write it off before trying it! Another favorite is the Stephanie's Red Velvet Cheesecake- so utterly rich and tasty.

So I've always known the cheesecake factory had exceptional food, but this experience completely ruined any good taste in my mouth. Nothing wrong with the service in particular just the manager Wesley!  So, my fiance ordered a mojito and it came garnished with a fluttering bug inside. She told the waiter she did not want to drink it, because she is creeped out by bugs. The server trying to recover the situation naturally brought a new drink for my fiance saying it was "on them" and he was so sorry for the drink she received prior. All was well til the bill came and the mojito was still there "not on them". At that time my fiance brought it to the servers attention and he said that shouldn't be on there let me talk to my boss. So the boss came to our table of 12 and asked so who had the bug in their drink? So she responded "me".  Feeling somehow like she did something wrong. Then the manager Wesley responded sorry we don't comp alcohol.  So my finances uncle left to talk to Wesley privately and let him know they didn't care about the $11 dollar drink it was about them charging her for it even though they said they would take care of it. Then Wesley told her that she should have told a manager not her server that there was a bug in her drink.(once again she feels she has done something wrong). Then she witnessed the manager go reprimand the bartender for the bug. And our poor server was visibly uncomfortable during this mess not having any power to enhance his guests experience. It took 20 minutes to remove the mojito from the check, and an additional 20 to process the payment.(probably a penalty for the complaint). I expected a higher degree of customer service from somewhere as corporate. But this company must clearly be going through a struggle if you hire people like Wesley to chase your guests away.
